title: Art Deco serif suggestions
content:
I am working on a packaging project designing sleeves that slip over boxes of chocolate (sort of like a slipcase). I am looking for Art Deco-ish typefaces to go with the existing packaging, which although it strictly isn't Art Deco, has a very 1920s feel to it. I work for a retailer that carries the brand and we are splitting the cost of the sleeves 50/50.

I've done a few searches, and I came across Goldenbook by Mark Simonson which I'll probably end up getting, but nothing else has really caught my eye. I want something that is elegant and feels luxurious, but isn't too avant garde.
author: adnix

comments.content: In their latest printed promo, House Industries showed Paperback used on packaging and it looked very lovely. Used correctly it could feel the right way. I think.

Have you been down the road of sans deco types like [Anisette](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=5&displayfontid=FB.100193.0.0&fontRendererText=chOcOlates), [Bernhard Fashion](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.100997.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Chocolates&sampleSize=96), [ITC Vintage](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.100474.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Chocolates&sampleSize=48) and [Arwen](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.9363.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Chocolate&sampleSize=48)?

I also think Mark's other '20s/'30s faces [Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=15&displayfontid=MSF.118749.0.0&fontRendererText=Chocolates) and [Coquette](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=3&displayfontid=MSF.118744.0.0&fontRendererText=Chocoholic+Delights) would be very tasty for chocolate packaging.

Inspiration: [Louise Fili](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/louisefili.com/)

Thanks for that link to Louise Fili, Stephen. I actually checked out "French Modern" from the library and scanned some pages for reference.

I bought Estilo through MyFonts earlier today and am playing with that.

I actually purchase Coquette about a year ago on another chocolate related project. However, I don't think it will work for this project.

I'm trying to avoid the high contrast Deco faces, which is why I was looking for a serif. I want my design to whisper Deco as opposed to shouting it.

Retro Serifs:

[McKenna](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/mckenna-handletter-nf/)

[Clearface](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=EF.6749.0.0)

I wish i could recommend [Odette](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/odette/) by Canada Type, but I'm afriad it's a bit of a sloppy rendition of Announcement Roman. I don't know of another version... may be workable if you don't mind cleaning it up a bit.

David, if you want it _serif_, you want it [Belwe](http://web.archive.org/web/20150407230139/http:/www.linotype.com/webshop/view.linotype?viewmode=search&searchFields%5B%5D=0&searchFields%5B%5D=2&PHPSESSID=69efa0f88d3eec017c5c912ebcb70b18&ACT=quicksearch&searchLogic=and&searchContent=true&wildcard=1&searchType=as_families&GROUP=&DISPLAYC=full&productClassificationLanguage=%25&searchTerm=Belwe).

More 30s, not so much contrast
